comment: overall great guy, i took this as a summer class so it was a bit more demanding and tech heavy, but it was still pretty easy. he was also very helpful if you needed it and it wasn't too insanely bad as an online class. Was only graded on quizzes, exams, one paper, and a couple discussion posts and that was it. WOULD RECOMMEND!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I would avoid this teacher but if you have to take it i would take it. You have to read a case every week, analyze it and thats your attendance. He puts in your grades at the end of the semester if you like not stressing about ur grade you might like this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The quizzes, midterm, and final were beyond difficult. All of the answers were almost identical with similar wording. VERY HARD. The midterm and final each count for 25% of your grade, and a big case brief paper at the end of the sem counts for 25%. A ton of quizzes/discussions make up the rest. Start on the paper early, or you'll struggle.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's pretty awkward and loves to go off on tangents while ignoring five people with their hands up. Other than that he's very knowledgable about the material. Don't expect to coast through this class; it's not just him, it's an information intensive course.

Not an easy A. Weekly 5 question quizzes, 3 discussion post, 2 Test aka Final and Midterm, and a 4 page case analysis. He provides a study guide for both the midterm and final. If you study what he provides you should pass. In addition, he curved both test for our class. I would definitely recommend taking him if you want to work for your grade.

Definitely not an easy A. Weekly 5 question quizzes, 3 discussion post, 2 Test aka Final and Midterm, and a 4 page case analysis. He provides a study guide for both the midterm and final. If you study what he provides you should pass. In addition, he curved both test for our class.

Took his criminal procedure class online. not hard at all, but he is a picky grader. If you don't have something he specifically wants, he docks points. Discussion post and weekly 5-question quiz. Test wasn't too hard as long as you study and prepare for it. Also assigns one paper, but it isnt unbearable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Post online lectures that are optional to watch, but helpful if you have time bc they're lengthy. Discussion post & quizzes weekly - questions were tricky & are timed. Very passionate about the subject. Tests are kind of hard, q's straight from book no answers online. 1 case brief which was extremely easy, took 2 hours max for it. Amazing teacher!

Professor Totten is a very charismatic, loud, passionate individual. His class was bearable and the topics discussed regarding laws were fairly interesting. In this class you will have 2 tests and one year long project that is not very difficult. One criticism is that he does not post any grades online.
Dr. Totten is a great professor. This is my 2nd time taking his class. Midterm, 2nd exam, presentation, paper (final). Classes are not that hard. If you need help, just ask him. He is there for you.

This dude is awesome! His class is set up for you to succeed and simultaneously learn, which is a rare find. I took him for CRJU 1101 as well as this maymester and am signed up for his legal analysis class. Dr. Totten is always willing to talk with you at length and provide clarity when needed. Academia needs more profs like him. Take his class!!

He is extremely knowledgeable which makes class that much better. He would take time to answer any and all questions. He never made a student feel less than. He is extremely smart and it shows. He is loud and his accent is a bit annoying. I will take him again if i get a chance. I learned a lot from him. Loved the "cheat sheet".

LOVE this professor. I am a CJ major, and he is so passionate about this subject. There are 4 tests and a final. You are allowed to have a 4 page (2 front&back) "cheat sheet" for tests and the reviews are just him giving you what is on the test exactly. The final is an easy group presentation. Warning though: heavy jersey-ish accent, talks loudly.

Amazing professor! VERY charismatic and enthusiastic about the course. Dr. Totten was always capable of answering students' questions with clarity. Very respectful to the students and provided feedback quickly. Final project is a group project, but instructions are clear. Textbook was assigned, however I managed well without it. Loved this class.

An amazing professor. He is really dedicated to what he teaches. Attendance is mandatory, but his class is a lot of fun and easy to follow. He does reference the textbook a lot. I, personally, didn't ever use it. It could be very helpful though and make the difference between and A and a B. 10/10 would take again.
He is super helpful in class . Everything he says  follows the powerpoints  .  attend his exam reviews.  he goes over the tests before hand.  would take again.

He is extremely loud and repeats himself constantly. I couldn't pay attention to any of his lectures because they are scattered and his voice makes my head pound. Scheduling is poor and constantly up in the air. I would not recommend this prof to anyone.
Great Professor from NJ shore so he has an accent. 4 Pages of notes on each test.

Long lectures based on power points. Can get a little boring, but he tries to get the class to participate. Super nice guy! Has detailed test review (basically tells you what questions will be on the test) & allows 4 pages of notes on tests. Posts power points on D2L. Easy group presentation. Would take the class again!

Professor Totten is awesome! He is very nice and is willing to help all the students. He likes participation. He lets you bring 4 notes for the tests and attend his review! He goes over what will be on the test! 3 tests and the final oral presentation. TAKE HIM!!
Professor Totten is very nice. He lets you bring 4 notes to use during the exams and have review session. Gives the topics and test questions. I recommend him.

He's great. 25% each: a presentation, 4 page paper, and 2 exams. He was very helpful in preparing you for the exams. Reading is assigned, and it is a good idea to do it, but if you pay attention you can get an A without it. But buy the book. He allows 4 1 side pages of notes in exams. Go to class every day, make notes tiny, and ace exams. Take him!

Dr. Totten is a great guy. He's funny and really wants his students to succeed. Lets you bring 4 pages of notes to all tests and gives reviews the week before. He inspired me to change my major to CJ. If you don't like lecture based classes, this might not be for you, but it's a pretty easy A!
Willing to help you out.  Has reviews for each test --- GO !!!  Showed some cool videos and we got to work in groups sometimes . Would take him agin.
He reads off of the powerpoint. Made me question why i chose him and why i even took the class. Boring class, attendance is mandatory. Not much of a fun class

I think Dr. Totten is awesome!! He's like watching a sober Jack Sparrow teach!! He has a relatively thick Jersey accent, which makes him a little hard to understand sometimes. But he's super nice and wants nothing more than for his students to succeed :) Take his class!! You won't regret it!!

I think Dr. Totten is awesome!! He's like watching a sober Jack Sparrow teach!! He sways and doesn't talk with his eyes open and has a relatively thick Jersey accent, which makes him a little hard to understand sometimes. But he's super nice and wants nothing more than for his students to succeed :)

Awesome professor! Extremely nice and would highly recommend him. Most of the material is on power points which are also posted online. 4 grades in the class for 25% each...2 exams, class presentation, and final paper. I will definitely take him again. Attendance is "required" but not enforced, though there is an attendance sheet every day.

Nice guy and very helpful. You get to use 4 pages of notes on exams. The class consists of 2 exams, a paper on a case brief, and a presentation on a case brief. Attendance is not mandatory, but highly encouraged.

Professor Totten is really interesting...he's from Jersey so he's a little difficult to understand sometimes. His powerpoint lectures are pretty clear on subject matter. Tests are a little difficult, however he holds an in-class review the class before the test (COME). There is a oral presentation as well, you orally present on a case briefing.

He is all over the place and is hard to get used to but he is a really nice guy and will help you out. However he wrote the book and I thought the book was horrible for an undergrad class and it also was $230
Nice guy! Clear lectures, and goes over the tests beforehand. Fun class to attend.
I learned a lot and he goes over the test before hand so they are not too bad. you can bring a few pages of notes which help

I enjoyed this class.  Professor uses slides in each class which help alot .  He also wrote the book so he really knows his stuff.If you put the work in you will do well --- there are 3 tests, 1 oral presentation and a paper

This class was harder than I thought. I had him for police in america and I have to say his test were different and the questions were nothing like the way he teaches. Very nice guy but I thought his clarity for this class was poor. The pages of notes for this class were not as useful as the other class I had with him before but class is passable
It was a fun class, mostly lecture. Prof Totton allows 4pg's of notes for the tests. He assignes 1 oral project (5 min presentation). Easy A or B. Take excellent notes and you will do fine.

I took this class as an easy filler...and that it was. He has review days for each test, but to get an A you should get the book b/c he likes you to read and makes things easier for you since ppt are just labeling mjr pts. I got an A without buying the book because I went to class. Attendance is extra credit if u have borderline grade, B 89.6 to A.

Totten seems to have trouble speaking in front of large groups and gets extremely nervous. Other than that, it really is a simple class. We have 3 tests, and he has allowed us to have four pages of notes for each test (including final) and this makes them easy to pass. I never bought the book, and I'm doing fine in the class. Attendance taken daily

Dr. Totten does take some getting used to, but I would take him again in a heartbeat. He does his best to make the class easy and interesting. He is always willing to listen and help. You can have 2 pgs front and back of notes for the test. Goes over the test in detail bef so you know exactly what to expect. Take him!

He is a really nice guy and is always willing to talk and help you out. But he does talk ALOT and really fast and repeats himself a million times. His powerpoints are helpful but i still thought the class was kind of hard. You get to use 2pgs of notes front/back on the test. Also he is one of the authors of the book so he really wants you to read!

He's all over the place but is really nice and willing to help if you need it. Let's you use 2 pages of notes on tests and posts powerpoints. Talks veryyy fast. I recommend taking him but he takes some getting used to.

Pros: He is very nice, he is very knowledgeable, willing to help when he can, you can use 2 pages of notes on tests, gives a grade on participation.  Cons: His voice is LOUD, he seems to be very ADD, repeats many things, and is very legalistic.  (He is a lawyer...)  Not the best class in the world, but overall it is good.

Professor Totten is a good guy. He repeats himself ALOT. Gets very old quick! His tests are easy. Allows his students to have notes for all tests which is nice. Attendence is mandatory, and wastes the first 10 min. of EVERY class lecturing how "students are required to be in class." Only made it through 3 chapters the whole semester, nice guy thoug

Dr. Totten was pretty good.  He's a little scrambled in his presentation, and he tends to repeat himself, but he is a really nice guy and tries very hard to get students interested.  He's extremely knowledgeable about the material and is very helpful if you go to his office hours.
Seems like a nice guy.  I like the PowerPoint lectures and small groups.  He also goes over the material for the exam and you can bring in a few pages too.
He is nice guy and answers your questions.  Writes everything down during class after explaining it. Also, helps you out with the exams before.
I like the small groups.  Tests are manageable if you study.  If you come to class, you will do well. He is a nice guy, too.

A very nice person. Seems we skip around in the book and does not look as if we will come close to finishing book. I get the impression that he has a difficult time teaching entry level classes. He seems to have a hard time finding a rhythm to his style and format.

Well Totten what is there to say seems like a nice guy but not a very good teacher. Rambles on for over half a class repeats himself over and over and is always mentioning New Jersey. Tests cover things he never mentioned. Just finished test 2 or 3 and have only covered 3 chapters.

Totten is extremely hyper and loud. He rambles on about everything. He talks really fast and loud and repeats the last three words of each sentence. He lives by the textbook and syllabus. He also scribbles illegible notes on the board. He's a nice guy, but apparently doesn't understand how to teach.
